title: Where have all the farms gone?
creator_contributor_role: National Film Board of Canada, production company
subject_group: Climate, Environment, Natural Resources & Disasters/Food chains
Agriculture, Business, Commerce & Industry/Farm life - Canada
Economics, Philosophy, Politics, Religion & Sociology/Canada - Economic conditions
description: Tumbledown, weatherbeaten old barns and dwellings stand like gaunt skeletons of other times, reproachful of an economy that let them down. Unable to compete with food-chain marketing, the farmers have moved into town, and eventually the bulldozer applies the final indignity to buildings that once represented a full and wholesome way of life. Filmed in 1969 in the Upper Ottawa Valley of Ontario and Quebec, this film carries nostalgia in its mute question: What price progress?
